turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Sure. But ya got a deck a cards? I wanna play some Klob.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: Come on, Charlie. We got business.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Couple hands. No harm in it.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: One move pardner, and you're a dead man.

turns.speaker: MASSERIA
turns.text: You can't kill me. You gave your word, Charlie.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: So? I'll get Bugs ta do it.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Don Maranzano. Welcome.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: I've heard so much about this club of yours. I had to come and see.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Good liquor draws a good crowd.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: I must know more of you, my son.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Not a lot ta know.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Then perhaps you need to know me.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Don, I'd be honored.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Salvatore. My young Caesar. First me, Sallie. Then you.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: The name's Charlie.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Mussolini is raping Sicily like every Roman before him. So our brothers are coming to America. Soldiers willing to fight and die. Men who know the meaning of honor.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Don, you talk about honor, but you mean vendetta. Killin' an' more killin' until nobody can remember how it all started.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: And how many soldiers do you have?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I've got friends.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: I have six hundred. Soldiers. And more every week off the boat.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: An' Masseria's got seven hundred.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: He's an animal!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: He's the Boss of all the Bosses, and I respect him.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: The Internal Revenue came to my offices. I turned over all my ledgers. They found nothing. Charlie, I am a businessman.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Sittin' around gives me the piles. You got a proposition?

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: We combine everything. You are my second in command.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: What about the share.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: You get fifteen percent.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I got partners.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Your Calabrian friend, I will accept. At least Costello eats pasta like us.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: And the Jews?

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Share with them as you wish. Do business with them on your own. But no filthy Jew will ever be a brother to me.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Tell me, my son. Why did you go with Giuseppe? He's not our kind.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I found that out.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: We learn from life.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: That's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Coming with me will be a delicate matter. We will work it out. But Charlie...

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Conditions have changed. Some people have become too powerful.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I'll take care of the Boss.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: If you give him the chance, Lansky will betray you like Judas.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I don't fuck my partners.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: No worry, Charlie. I will kill them for you. No one will know.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: At first, it will hurt you. But you will come to understand and we will be strong together.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You're fuckin' crazy. You're all fuckin' crazy!

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Even the beasts of the earth know who rightfully reigns.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: They do what I tell 'em.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Salvatore. Always holding himself above.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You and me both. Sal-va-to-re.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: We must be friends, Charlie.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Keep my terms and I won't be your enemy.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: The terms will be mine.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: The guy doin' the job names the price. If you don't like it, you can kill Masseria yourself.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: I will be the Boss of All Bosses.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: What makes you think I give a damn about that Sicilian crap?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Tell it to the Calabrian. Tell it to the Jews.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: You disrespect our tradition.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Boss, we got our own tradition. We call it treatin' your friends right, and not bein' a pig for every scrap of glory.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Forget it. That's past.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: No matter what you say to me Salvatore, you are my bambino.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me that Maranzano had made you an offer?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: I turned him down flat.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: And if I had known, I would have warned you to expect this. We could have prepared.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Masseria's been after me too.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Thank you for keeping me informed.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: We were overdue to get hit.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: You think this is a coincidence? Next week half your customers will be buying their Scotch, our Scotch, from Maranzano. In a month, he'll be in Scotland talking to my distillers, because you can't move product. I'll be out of business, and you'll be working for Maranzano.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: We can operate around these guys.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Not by scurrying around like a puppies in a roomful of elephants.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Okay. I'm listening.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: A hundred years ago Austria was run by a prince named Metternich. Austria was weak, and it's neighbors were strong. But they were ruled by passionate men, while Metternich was ruthless and brilliant. If one country got too strong, he rallied an alliance against it. He would lead all of Europe to the brink of war, then bring the enemies together and forge the peace.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Strategy.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Talk English. Okay? I did lousy at school.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: The Big Picture.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: That's just what I'm sick of. Everybody lookin' ta knock somebody off! Greedy for what you got. A bunch of fuckin' hogs at the trough.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: So change it.

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: Bring order out of chaos. If you lead... they'll follow.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: And what do you want out of this?

turns.speaker: ROTHSTEIN
turns.text: A peaceful and prosperous retirement.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Know somethin'? This stuff's just kick-the-can on ponies.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Shuddup.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Wanna know what I think?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Spare us.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: I think these rich shits -- no offense Bobby -- are so dead below the waist that they gotta ride around all day swingin' at each other ta get their broads hot.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Those fucks can't leave each other alone. Maranzano and Masseria ain't gonna be satisfied until one of 'em starts a war.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Let 'em kill each other off! Why should we care?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: There won't be any way to stay out of it.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Where's the stiff?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Come on. Be polite.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Sorry, Charlie. I gotta get my Johnson worked tonight.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Hell. It's been four days!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Fuck 'em.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Johnson's still on board. Even Maranzano won't screw with Nucky in Atlantic City. But everywhere else, we got nothing but problems.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: I'll knock 'em in, Charlie. I can do it. Blow his fuckin' head off. Get rid of the bastard for good.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: You wouldn't live out the week.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Masseria's scared. He might make our deal.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: We can't sell out to those guys. They ain't businessmen!

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: So we're gonna knock 'em both off?

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: If it comes to that. Yeah.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Maranzano wants you dead.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Yeah. But he needs me alive.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Everybody's talkin' about ya, Charlie. First time anybody ever got took for a ride and lived.

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Guess I'm just lucky.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: That's just what they're calling ya pal. Lucky Luciano.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: I'm a hard guy. I done more jobs than alla you combined. And I never said no. Not once. But dammit I don't understand why the hell we gotta kill our friends!

turns.speaker: LUCIANO
turns.text: Because the world ain't big enough for the Dons. So we gotta choose between our friends and ourselves. It ain't the way I'd make the world, but that's the way it is.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MAD DOG COLL
turns.text: I'm comin' for my twenty thousand.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Luciano is dead?

turns.speaker: MAD DOG COLL
turns.text: Open a window. Every newsboy in town's screamin' about it.

turns.speaker: MAD DOG COLL
turns.text: What a cozy little scene.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Kill them! Kill them!

turns.speaker: MAD DOG COLL
turns.text: What's it worth to ya, Boss?

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: Anything!

turns.speaker: MAD DOG COLL
turns.text: Anything ain't a very hard number.

turns.speaker: MARANZANO
turns.text: One hundred thousand. No... three hundred thousand.

turns.speaker: MAD DOG COLL
turns.text: Now that's a hard number.

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: Jeez, Bugsy. Ya like ta scared the crap outta me.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Just wanted ta say hello.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Know something Tommy? You're a mensch.

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: That a Jew compliment?

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Best we got.

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: Awww... deep down I'm a bastard, but when ya got eight kids ya can't make enemies.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Guess so. Ya got a minute? I got somethin' for ya.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: Take any one ya like.

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: Kinda early for Christmas, Bugs.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: A Jew's gotta let his heart tell him when ta give his presents.

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: You're fuckin' crazy.

turns.speaker: SIEGEL
turns.text: But only on purpose, Tommy.

turns.speaker: REINA
turns.text: This is nice. I mean it.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Now don't pick a fight. I'm staying over.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Oh, poor Buster. He hasn't been fed in a day and a half. Let me get some food...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Special occasion?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I don't know. I guess it was...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Who did this?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Stu. That was right about the time we met.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: When he first came in to the sleep lab?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Yeah...before your time.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Jesus, honey...he always joked about you <u>curing</u> him, but I never realized what you cured him <u>from</u>.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He hadn't gotten a good night's sleep in years. The nightmares would wake him up, and he'd start right in painting... That boy looked like pluperfect hell.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: How do you get from <u>here</u> - to <u>there</u>?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Switch hands.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm serious. It was bicameral disjunction - right brain and left brain out of balance. He was a rightie, so I made him switch the pencil to his left hand. Just to see what'd come out.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Monkeybone?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Left-handed, he was funny. He'd been doing all this scary, intense work...then he found out he could draw this stuff, and make me laugh, and he liked that. And then the nightmares just...stopped.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Wow - two guys in the same brain. - Which one did you fall in love with?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What's the maximum safe dose?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Most we've ever used is half a CC.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Five CC's.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: The thing is, I'm responsible for the way he's acting. It's the nightmare juice. It's got to be.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Julie, that stuff probably saved his life.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I can't explain this, Alice, but I'm not so sure it did. It's as if...he's not Stu any more. The Stu I love is gone! He spends all his time in the garage. He says he's...autographing.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: "4/17: Subject, when unaware of observation, prefers to hold eating utensils...with feet. Successfully carves turkey roll holding eating utensils...with feet."

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: They had a case like that at Johns Hopkins. Wires got crossed between hands and feet.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Chasing me - animals - horrible -

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Animals? What <u>kind</u> of animals?

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Yeah, I know - Picasso. <u>Guernica</u>, right? That's what everybody says - although personally, I don't see the resemblance. What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Uhh - martini?

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Olive or eyeball?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Olive. - Where exactly am I?

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Dark Town. Land of nightmares. I'm Bull.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Stu Miley.

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Yeah, I've seen a few of your dreams. You're quite a celebrity down here.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Jeez, it all looks like bad late-night cable.

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Sad commentary, huh?

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I was, uh, just getting ready to leave...

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Yo, Jumbo. We got us some kind of <u>ventriloquist</u> here.

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Hey, Stu, why so glum? Everybody loves a good humiliation nightmare.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Three months, Bull. Three months tonight. Three months since the accident - and I'm no closer to going home than I was then.

turns.speaker: BULL
turns.text: Aw, buck up. Have another 'tini.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'm sick of martinis. I'm sick of the waiting, and the carnival rides, and watching people's <u>nightmares</u>. And of course, I need not <u>add</u> -

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You're mad at me. Great. You have every right to be. But we're both mad at Dark Town. We're both mad at Hypnos.

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: Oh, sure. Now you're gonna tell me it was all <u>his</u> idea. You were completely innocent -

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'm not going to tell you that. I wanted that E- ticket. I wanted it so bad I'd stare <u>you</u> right in the face to get it - and I'd do the same again.

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: <u>Why</u>??

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I have a girl up there. And I never - I should've - I just want to tell her I love her.

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: I'm a simple man. I'm just doing my job. I <u>enjoy</u> my job. Why does everyone want to make it difficult for me? Stealing tickets, switching bodies...it is <u>so</u> <u>irresponsible</u>.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Death, I'm trying to make things right. Take my soul. Turn me into a paper doll. But give me just one lousy hour.

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: Well - you'd need a body.

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: If it wasn't for that comic strip of yours, I wouldn't be doing this. But a good chuckle is darned hard to come by. That one where Monkeybone stole the soap cake out of the urinal - I thought I would die.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Coming from you, that's quite a compliment.

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: De nada. Now, come here...bend over...before I change my mind.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Bend over?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: DEATH!!

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: I dress up when I want to make an impression. - So how'd it go?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Fine, thanks. Saw my girl, said goodbye, everything's gonna be okay. I guess I'm yours now.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Hey. Where's Monkeybone?

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: Back in your head, where he belongs. No offense, Stu, but on your own you're kinda vanilla. I didn't want to send you back without him.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Back? You're sending me back?

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: It's irregular, but...I just love that strip of yours. I figure I'll take the "Family Circus" guy instead.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Death! Thank you!

turns.speaker: DEATH
turns.text: Thank me next time you see me.

turns.speaker: DR. EDELSTEIN
turns.text: Vital signs have stabilized. That's good.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Can you give us a realistic sense of my brother's chances?

turns.speaker: DR. EDELSTEIN
turns.text: He's held on this far. We can't do much but wait and see.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: But these...machines are what's keeping him alive, is that right?

turns.speaker: DR. EDELSTEIN
turns.text: At the moment, yes.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Can you give me a realistic idea...of how long this is going to last?

turns.speaker: DR. EDELSTEIN
turns.text: Comas are unpredictable. He could wake up today, tomorrow, a month from now...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Honey, I have to clarify this. The thing is, Dr. Edelstein, my brother has an absolute <u>horror</u> of doctors - hospitals - needles - all of it -

turns.speaker: DR. EDELSTEIN
turns.text: Three months. There's always some brain damage. But at three months...the chances of coming back shrink dramatically with every day.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I want him to have every chance, Doctor. We can certainly give it...three months.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: I think it's a pig hair. How much is McDonald's offering?

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Less.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Oh, here's something. The city zoo is kicking off a fund-raising campaign. They wonder if you'd be willing to appear at a benefit.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Well, nothing. It's a benefit. But we could probably get <u>People</u> and <u>Entertainment Tonight</u> to cover it.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: I get it. We could give the public the impression that we were doing something... charitable. Brilliant!!

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: And last...you remember Bill here, from the Bazoom Toy Company? He's got a little something I think you'll like.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: You're really gonna pop the question?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Got the ring. Got the airline tickets. Soon as they break that piñata, we'll grab a cab - and it's off to the land of palm trees and coconuts.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: I can't believe you. You used to hate being the center of attention. Now you're proposing, in public, at a benefit.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Yeah, I was thinking...I mean, I'm a celebrity now, do I really want to get married? But on the other hand, if you're married, they can't testify against you.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Sorry, Julie - won't be a minute. Now Stu - I know you don't like the idea, but you really ought to talk to these guys -

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Julie and I - we were just gonna go...

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Go? There's a potload of money here, pal. You got three major toy companies...you got the guys from Burger God over here...

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Burger God. The ones that found the pig hair in the french fries?

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Never proven. They're ready to pop for a pre- emptive endorsement. Kids love Burger God -

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Herb, it's too much. It's all out of hand.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Do you know what kind of opportunity you have here? You gotta <u>strike</u>. I'm talking mansions. Lamborghinis. Champagne for mouthwash when you brush your teeth!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I don't want to be rich. It's just a trap!

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Being rich is <u>not a trap</u>. That is a dirty lie perpetuated by rich people to keep the failures from killing them.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Herb. <u>I have to go</u>.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I got the ring. Tonight's the night, Herb. Tonight's the night.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Oh my God...you're proposing?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: My life was totally crappy, Herb, and she... fixed it. She made me happy. Which I'd never been. She loves me the way I am - right now. I don't want everything to change. I don't want her saying yes to some big success. I just want her saying yes to me.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: ...In some weird way I respect that.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: So here's my idea. We do a giveaway at the zoo benefit. We get a big piñata. We fill it with Monkeybone dolls - <u>hundreds</u> of 'em.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: A piñata. That's a <u>great</u> idea!

turns.speaker: HUTCH
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He's stuck in a loop - a nightmare loop. Anybody here know what Oneirix is?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No. I want to give him <u>more</u>. I want to give him a massive dose.

turns.speaker: HUTCH
turns.text: That's not going to stop his nightmare -

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I don't want to <u>stop</u> the nightmare, Hutch. I want to crank it up. I want to take it right off the charts. I want to <u>scare him awake</u>.

turns.speaker: HUTCH
turns.text: You know, Julie, even if this works - which it probably won't - that stuff is tricky. You don't know what it'll do to his brain.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What'll it do if they pull the plug?

turns.speaker: HUTCH
turns.text: The Nightmare Juice! It's gone! Somebody switched it for a beaker of grape Kool-Aid!!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Kool-Aid!? But who'd would want to -

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Wait a minute. Stu Miley, right? Boys and girls ...Mr. Stu Miley, in the house! This is an honor. We see a lot of nightmares down here, but yours are like caviar, man. You da shits!!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Mr. Hypnos, I saw a dream. My girlfriend was having it. She dreamed they were pulling the plug on me. She was watching me <u>die</u>.

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Uh huh. And?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Well, I have to get a message to her. I have to let her know I'm <u>okay</u>. Until I can get out of here...

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Kid - didn't they tell you about this party?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Tell me what?

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: It's a special kind of party. A <u>farewell</u> party. Do you...get what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Farewell? You mean - you mean I'm -

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I think I...I'm about to... Am I mistaken, or don't I get to... Is there some...

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Y'see, Stu, as I understand it, you made this pact with your sister...no life support?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Besides, Julie wouldn't...she'd never...

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Actually, Stu, Julie doesn't get to decide. That's why she was having the nightmare. They're pulling the plug at nine AM.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Nine AM! But that's - <u>twelve hours</u>.

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Stu, I like you personally, I admire your work, but I'm just the God of Sleep. This is Death's bailiwick.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Maybe you could talk to Death!

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Me? <u>Me</u>, go crawling to Death? My friend, it will be a cold, cold day in Las Vegas, Nevada, before I go crawling to <u>that</u> piece of -

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Now Death is not what you would call a people person, like me. Death is a <u>putz</u> - and I should know. I'm his little brother.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You're Death's <u>brother</u>?

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Oh yeah. Mr. By-the-book, Stick-Up-the-Ass, My- Way-or-the-Highway Death. Believe me - over the course of eternity, you get pretty damned tired of that schtick. So I need a job. He sticks me in this broke-down amusement park, with a buncha animals to run it. I'm supposed to be grateful?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Guys, I don't mean to be rude, but I only have eleven hours and fifty-three minutes to...

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Oh, right. Cheating Death. There's <u>one thing</u> you might try. Only one guy in <u>history</u> ever pulled it off. Well, actually two. Actually, no, there was that other guy who...well, <u>very few people</u> have done it.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Hyp, I'll do anything.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Land of Death. How do I get there?

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Kid, listen: <u>that's all I'm saying</u>. And you didn't hear it from me.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: NO! DON'T YOU UNDERSTAND?? HE'S GOT MY E-TICKET! HE'S GOT MY -

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Sorry, Stu. It's all part of the deal. We've got <u>big plans</u> for that body of yours!

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Sorry, Steve, maybe next time. And how's our new guest settling in - ?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: YOU SET ME UP!!

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Easy, pal! I was coming to congratulate you. It ain't easy snatching one of those E-tickets. Steve here was the last guy to pull it off, and that musta been, what, 25 years ago...?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Why'd you do it? What'd I ever do to you?!?

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: It's simple, Stu. We need nightmares - lots of 'em. So whenever we can swing it, we send a guy up to stimulate the flow...a <u>nightmare maker</u>! Like Steve here. Poe. Rasputin...we've been doing this all the way back to Atilla and Genghis Khan!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: But <u>why me</u>? Why'd you pick on <u>me</u>??

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: The monkey, of course. It was his idea.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Monkeybone...!?

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Nobody wants to be a sidekick, Stu. So one day he comes to us - he's got a proposition. We help him get your body...in return he gives us all the nightmares we want.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: You're nuts! I'm a comic strip artist! What's he gonna do - draw <u>really scary cartoons</u>??

turns.speaker: HYPNOS
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no. Y'see, Stu, as it happens, that girlfriend of yours figured out the chemical basis of bad dreams. And she just whipped up a big old batch of nightmare juice!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Oh, baby, I can't believe you're back.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Home sweet home, huh? Actually, I was expecting something a little swankier. How much loot does old Stu rake in, anyway?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Meaning me, of course. I'm referring to myself. You have to assume Monkeybone would be a pretty lucrative franchise...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Baby? Why don't you just...rest on the sofa for a minute. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Bitchin' good cake.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Stu, are you...feeling okay?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Sure. Why?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You're acting kind of...odd.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: In what way?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What are you watching?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Ohhh, nothing.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You sure this is...medically advisable?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Got a doctor on duty.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Well. As long as it's okay with Monkeybone -

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Priceless! Priceless! This stuff just <u>kills</u> me!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm heading in to work, baby. Are you sure you'll be okay?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Oh yeah. There's just one thing I don't get. "Monkeybone Creator Awakens from Coma" that's a big story! That's front page news! But I can't find a word of coverage in this stinkin' rag! Hey. Don't I have a TV show?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: They only made the one episode. They've shown it about nineteen times.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: I need a new PR guy.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: And speaking of which, here's the light of my life, the pert and saucy Miss Julie McElroy.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I had to park two blocks away. Is something -

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What's this about merchandising? You always hated merchandising!

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Well, baby, I do, but to look at it from another angle...there's a <u>potload</u> of money here.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Stu? Is that you? Where did you <u>go</u>?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Me? Nowhere. I was asleep.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Baby, don't lie. I know you went out.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Not me. Nope. You must've been dreaming.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You're wearing a <u>topcoat</u>, Stu. - Where are your pants?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: <u>Well</u>, Miss Smarty, if I didn't go out, I wouldn't <u>need</u> any pants. Now would I?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: We'll hop a plane tonight. An island ceremony. An Abba Dabba honeymoon!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It looks so...<u>new</u>.

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: It is new. Why wouldn't it be new?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: But the heirloom ring. Your grandmother's ring...

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Heirloom? Huh? You want a <u>used ring</u> - ?

turns.speaker: STU-BONE
turns.text: Boy, the nuts are out tonight. What'd that creep call you - ?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He called me "Doc."

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You want to leave? But Stu - you're a big hit! Everyone loves you!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: They don't love me. They love Monkeybone.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It was you who got the standing O. It was you drawing on the belly over there...

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: That was especially Monkeybone. Come on, Doc, I don't want to be stuck here with this bunch of media creeps. I just want to be us. Home. Alone! I have something I have to give you.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Can't you give it to me later?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Yeah, I <u>could</u>, but the thing is, if later got here sooner, it would be...better.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Look at this! He won't let us leave!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: The monkey!! He's everywhere! He'll take over both our lives if we let him.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Stu - stop it. That monkey is <u>good luck</u>. You thought him up, and everybody loves him, and he's probably going to make you rich. So relax! Enjoy it!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'm trying. It's weird, that's all. I never had any good luck, until I met you...what if it's all just another bad dream?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What's the "bad" part?

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I might wake up.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: If you do, I'll be right there beside you. So face it. You're just going to have to be happy!

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I am happy. It just so happens this is the happiest night of my life.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Did we just - <u>hit</u> something?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: Are you okay??

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm fine, baby. We're all okay. We were lucky.

turns.speaker: STU
turns.text: I'd better go report this...
